definition: (of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 起航[qi3 hang2]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

sentences.english: Minutes later, we cast off and headed offshore in a southerly direction.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟以后，我们启航向南驶去。

sentences.english: I'm studying at Qihang bilingual school, in Class 2, Grade 4.
sentences.chinese: 我住在仙河镇，我在启航双语学校四年级二班上学。

sentences.english: Please reconfirm with the airplane company in 72 hours before the flight.
sentences.chinese: 在启航前的七十二小时内跟航空公司再确认。
船启航时，汤姆挥了挥手。

sentences.english: Captain Alison will set out at eight o'clock so we shall have plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森船长将于8点钟启航，因此我们有充裕的时间。

sentences.english: He will set sail next week.
The voyage was put back twenty- four hours owing to bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 因天气恶劣而推迟了二十四小时启航。

sentences.english: Standing on the jetty as the steamer moves away.
sentences.chinese: 轮船启航时见你在码头上。

sentences.english: Even as We sail and sail, We are a still picture.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我们启航，扬帆远航，我们是一个静止图像。

sentences.english: The ship of China-US relations, moored for so long, again set sail, braving the wind and waves.
sentences.chinese: 停航许久的中美关系大船又乘风破浪启航了。

sentences.english: Do something that moves you closer to shipping.
sentences.chinese: 做些可以让你接近启航的事情吧。

sentences.english: His ship hooted for three times and started.
sentences.chinese: 他乘坐的客轮鸣了三声汽笛后启航了。

sentences.english: Make sail with the first favorable wind.

sentences.chinese: 绝世好工作，七月启航帆。

sentences.english: Before sailing, we recruited our provisions.
sentences.chinese: 启航前，我们补充了给养。

definition: (of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
to set out on a journey
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
